Description: Fragment of the neck of an Attic black-figured pottery ovoid neck-amphora. Inside glazed above, reserved below. Outside, on neck, head of a youth to left between zigzags, one of which remains. The fillet between neck and shoulder seems to have had added red.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of Vatican 309 ((Venit))
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Painter of Vatican 309. The drawing of the youth's profile with its strongly sloping nose and well defined lips, and the eye with its high eyebrow are very close to those of the man on Oxford G 131.21 by the painter (CVA Great Britain 9: pl.1 fig.35; ABV 122, 20), and the strongly hooked collarbones are paralleled on other males by the Painter of Vatican 309. Compare, for example, Munich 1445 (CVA Germany 32: pl.327 figs. 3-4; ABV 116, 3 and 121,9).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 73, no. 241 pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0851)
